justification: Package has zero outgoing dependencies (Ce=0) and zero incoming dependencies (Ca=0). With no dependencies, it cannot depend on a less stable component, and its own stability is maximal (I=1.0) when defined, which trivially satisfies the Stable Dependencies Principle.
Package instability (I=0.571) is higher than one of its dependencies (org.apache.commons.io.output with I=0.600).

Package instability I=0.353 (Ce=6, Ca=11). It depends on packages with higher instability: org.apache.commons.io.filefilter (I=0.571, Ce=4, Ca=3), org.apache.commons.io.input (I=0.700, Ce=7, Ca=3), org.apache.commons.io.file (I=0.417, Ce=5, Ca=7), org.apache.commons.io.output (I=0.600, Ce=6, Ca=4).
The package depends on 'org.apache.commons.io.input', which has a lower stability (I=0.3) than the current package's stability (I≈0.333).
The package's stability (I=0.22) is lower than its outgoing dependencies: org.apache.commons.io.file (I=0.42) and org.apache.commons.io (I=0.35). Therefore, it depends on more stable packages.
The analyzed package has stability I=0 (Ca=0, Ce=1) and depends on org.apache.commons.io which has stability I≈0.647 (Ca=11, Ce=6). The dependency is more stable than the package, so no violation.
The package has no outgoing dependencies (Ce=0) and thus does not depend on any other package.

Package stability I = Ce/(Ce+Ca) = 5/(5+7) = 0.417. Outgoing dependency 'org.apache.commons.io.filefilter' has stability 4/(4+3)=0.571 > 0.417 (less stable). Outgoing dependency 'org.apache.commons.io.output' has stability 6/(6+4)=0.6 > 0.417 (less stable). These violate the Stable Dependencies Principle.

The package has an instability index of 0.6 (Ce=6, Ca=4). All its outgoing dependencies have lower instability indexes: org.apache.commons.io.build (0.6667), org.apache.commons.io.function (0.2222), org.apache.commons.io (0.3529), org.apache.commons.io.charset (0), org.apache.commons.io.input (0.7), org.apache.commons.io.file (0.4167). The package only depends on packages that are more stable than itself.

The analyzed package's instability (I=1.00) is higher than or equal to the instability of all its outgoing dependencies: org.apache.commons.io.filefilter (I=0.57), org.apache.commons.io (I=0.35), org.apache.commons.io.file (I=0.42), org.apache.commons.io.file.attribute (I=0.00), org.apache.commons.io.comparator (I=0.50).

The analyzed package has a stability index of 0 (Ca=0, Ce=1) which is more stable than its only dependency 'org.apache.commons.io' with stability index ~0.353 (Ca=11, Ce=6). Since dependencies are directed toward more stable components, no Unstable Dependency smell is present.

The analyzed package has stability I=1.0 (Ce=2, Ca=0). Its outgoing dependencies have stabilities I=0.222 (org.apache.commons.io.function, Ce=2, Ca=7) and I=0.353 (org.apache.commons.io, Ce=6, Ca=11). Both dependencies are more stable (lower I) than the analyzed package, thus following the Stable Dependencies Principle.

The analyzed package has instability I=0.7 (Ce=7, Ca=3). All outgoing dependencies have lower instability: org.apache.commons.io.build (I=0.67), org.apache.commons.io.function (I=0.22), org.apache.commons.io (I=0.35), org.apache.commons.io.charset (I=0.0), org.apache.commons.io.file (I=0.42), org.apache.commons.io.output (I=0.6), org.apache.commons.io.file.attribute (I=0.0). Since no dependency is less stable, no unstable dependency is detected.

The package's stability (S = Ca/(Ca+Ce) = 1/(1+1) = 0.5) is less than the stability of its sole outgoing dependency, 'org.apache.commons.io' (S = 11/(11+6) ≈ 0.647). Therefore, it depends on a more stable package, adhering to the Stable Dependencies Principle.

The package has Ce=0 (no outgoing dependencies), implying it does not depend on any less stable packages. Its Ca=2 indicates it has incoming dependencies, and it has a stability index (I=Ce/(Ca+Ce)=0) of 0, which is maximally stable. Therefore, no violation of the Stable Dependencies Principle is present.
